member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.Blending
member.summary: The blending function for transparent rendering mode.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color, ignoring the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color values.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows. The backdrop color is not replaced but is mixed with the source color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the backdrop

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.Blending.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.DestinationViewMode
member.summary: The view mode when an explicit destination is displayed in the viewer.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.DestinationViewMode.XYZ
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the coordinates (left, top) positioned at the upper-left corner of the window and the contents of the page magnified by the factor zoom. A null value for any of the parameters left, top, or zoom specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged. A zoom value of 0 has the same meaning as a null value.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.DestinationViewMode.Fit
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the page within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitB
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically. If the required horizontal and vertical magnification factors are different, use the smaller of the two, centering the bounding box within the window in the other dimension.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitBH
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the vertical coordinate top positioned at the top edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window. A null value for top specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.DestinationViewMode.FitBV
member.summary: Display the page designated by page, with the horizontal coordinate left positioned at the left edge of the window and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window. A null value for left specifies that the current value of that parameter is to be retained unchanged.

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore
member.summary: Provides and interface for getting digital certificates from system certificates store or from a password protected PKCS#12 file. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public keys and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the Personal Certificates store. The Personal Certificates store can be accessed from Control Panel/Internet Options, Content, Certificates.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(EvoWordToPdf.CertSystemStore)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified system certificates store.
member.param: The system certificates store

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified PKCS#12 file. This method uses a NULL password to get the certificates from packet. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The path of the .pfx or .p12 file storing the certificates.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified password protected PKCS#12 file. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The path of the .pfx or .p12 file storing the certificates.

The password used to decrypt and verify the PFX packet. This password must be exactly the same as the password that was used to encrypt the packet. If the password used to encrypt the packet was blank, pass NULL for the value of this parameter.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.DigitalCertificatesStore.GetCertificates(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Gets the certificates collection from the specified password protected PKCS#12 file given as binary data. A PKCS#12 file stores both the private and the public key and such a file can be for example a file with extension .pfx generated by IIS from the SSL certificate installed for a website.
member.param: The PFX file data

The password used to decrypt and verify the PFX packet. This password must be exactly the same as the password that was used to encrypt the packet. If the password used to encrypt the packet was blank, pass NULL for the value of this parameter.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.Document.Close
member.summary: Releases all the resources allocated by this PDF document. Always call this method after the document was saved. If the document was created from a stream or file, the stream will be closed if it was not explicitly detached by calling the DetachStream() before the document is closed.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.Document.DetachStream

member.summary: Gets or sets the PDF document compression level. By default the compression level is

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Document.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the generated PDF. By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated PDF. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated PDF is lower than the quality of the original images in the Word document, function of the parameter. When the is increased, the quality of the images in PDF decreases.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Document.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level of images in the generated PDF as an integer value between 0 and 100. This property has effect only when the JpegCompressionEnabled is true. When the is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst. The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in PDF.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.DocumentViewerPreferences.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: The document’s page mode, specifying how to display the document on exiting full-screen mode. This entry is meaningful only if the value of the PageMode entry in the catalog dictionary is FullScreen; it is ignored otherwise. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.ImageElement
member.summary: Objects of this class can be added to a PDF document to render images

member.name: E:EvoWordToPdf.ImageElement.PrepareRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised after the Image element created the PDF page and before starting rendering it. In the handler of this event the PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer can still be changed before starting rendering.

member.name: E:EvoWordToPdf.ImageElement.BeforeRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right before the page is rendered by Image element. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the background of the PDF page to be rendered.

member.name: E:EvoWordToPdf.ImageElement.AfterRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the Image Element finished PDF page rendering. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the foreground of the rendered PDF page.

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.LineJoinStyle
member.summary: This enumeration represents the possible styles to join the lines in a PDF document

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.LineJoinStyle.Default
member.summary: Default line join style.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.LineJoinStyle.MiterJoin
member.summary: The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the miter limit parameter— see "Miter Limit"), a bevel join is used instead.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.LineJoinStyle.RoundJoin
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments. This pie slice-shaped figure is filled in, producing a rounded corner.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.LineJoinStyle.BevelJoin
member.summary: The two segments are finished with caps (see "Line Cap Style") and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle.

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter
member.summary: This class is the main class of the Word to PDF Converter which offers the necessary methods to create a PDF document from a Word file or a Word stream. The generated PDF document can be saved into a memory buffer or into a file

member.name: E:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.PrepareRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised after the Word to PDF converter created the PDF page and before starting rendering it. In the handler of this event the PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer can still be changed before starting rendering.

member.name: E:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.BeforeRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right before the page is rendered by Word to PDF converter. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the background of the PDF page to be rendered.

member.name: E:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.AfterRenderPdfPageEvent
member.summary: The event is raised right after the Word to PDF converter finished PDF page rendering. The PDF page configuration like size, orientation, header or footer is already defined and cannot be changed. In the handler of this event PDF elements can be added in the foreground of the rendered PDF page.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a Word to PDF converter using the default settings

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key string received from the vendor in Word to PDF converter. If this property is null the converter will automatically enter in evaluation mode and a demo watermark will be displayed on the generated PDF document.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.PdfDocumentOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the conversion process and the generated PDF document properties. This property can be used to control the PDF document margins, PDF compression level, JPEG compression level, the PDF page size and orientation, the PDF document headers and footers, true type fonts embedding, fit width and stretch to fit, conversion to a single PDF page, append or prepend external PDF documents.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.PdfDocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object to controlling the generated PDF document information like the document title, author, subject or creation date.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object to controlling the generated PDF document security settings like user and owner password, restrict printing or editing of the generated PDF document.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.PdfHeaderOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object to control the generated PDF document header options. The header is displayed in the generated PDF document only if the property is true.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.PdfFooterOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object to control the generated PDF document footer options. The footer is displayed in the generated PDF document only if the property is true.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.PdfViewerPreferences
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling how the generated PDF is displayed by a PDF viewer.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.WordToPdfConverter.PdfConverterConcurrencyLevel
member.summary: This static parameter gives the maximum number of threads in the current .NET application domain that can convert Word to PDF simultaneously. This parameter must be set before the first conversion performed in the current application domain. When this property is set with a negative value or zero the concurrency level is maximum. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.LeftMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document left margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the left margin is 0.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.RightMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document right margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the right margin is 0.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.TopMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document top margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the top margin is 0.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.BottomMargin
member.summary: The rendered PDF document bottom margin in points. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the left margin is 0.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.X
member.summary: The X coordinate in points where to start rendering in first page. By default the left location is 0

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.Y
member.summary: The Y coordinate in points where to start rendering in first page. By default the top location is 0

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.Width
member.summary: The width in points of the destination rectangle in PDF page where the content is rendered. By default the destination width is the available width in PDF page

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.Height
member.summary: The height in points of the destination rectangle in PDF page where the content is rendered. By default the destination height is automatically calculated to render the whole content

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.TopSpacing
member.summary: A space in points to introduce at the top of PDF pages where the content is rendered. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the top spacing is 0.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.BottomSpacing
member.summary: A space in points to introduce at the bottom of PDF pages where the content is rendered. 1 point is 1/72 inch. By default the bottom spacing is 0.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.BackColor
member.summary: The PDF pages background color

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfCompressionLevel
member.summary: This property controls the compression level of the PDF document created by the converter.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.JpegCompressionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the JPEG compression is enabled or not for the images in the PDF document created by the converter. By default the JPEG compression is enabled to reduce the size of the generated PDF. When the JPEG compression is enabled the quality of the images in the generated PDF is lower than the quality of the original images in the document, function of the parameter. When the is increased, the quality of the images in PDF decreases.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.JpegCompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level of images in the PDF document generated by the converter as an integer value between 0 and 100. This property has effect only when the is true. When the is 0, the compression rate is the lowest and the quality of the images is the best. When the is 100, the compression rate is the highest and quality of the images in PDF is the worst. The default JPEG compression level is 10, which should offer a good balance between the compression rate and the quality of the images in PDF.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.CompressCrossReference
member.summary: Set this property on true to store the cross-reference table and the trailer of the PDF document generated by the converter in compressed cross-reference streams and to reduce the PDF file size. The default value is false

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfStandardSubset
member.summary: Defines the PDF subset used by the PDF document generated by the converter. The default value is Full. This property can be used to instruct the converter to generate PDF/A or PDF/X compliant documents.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the color space of the PDF document generated by the converter. The possible values are RGB, CMYK or Gray Scale. The default color space is RGB.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ColorProfile
member.summary: Gets or sets the color profile of the PDF document generated by the converter.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.FitWidth
member.summary: When this property is true the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page of the PDF document generated by the converter. By default this property is true and the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. When this property is false the content is not resized (is rendered at the real size) and therefore it could be cut off at the right size if the PDF page is not enough wide to display the whole content. In this case the property can be set on true to automatically resize the PDF page width to display the whole content.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.FitHeight
member.summary: When this property is true the content will be resized if necessary to fit the available height in PDF page of the PDF document generated by the converter. By default this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.StretchToFit
member.summary: This property has effect in converter only when property is true. When is true and this property is true the content will be stretched if necessary to fit the available width in PDF page. By default this property is false and the content will not be stretched to fit the available width in PDF page.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.SinglePage
member.summary: When this property is true the converter will generate a single PDF page with a custom size calculated to display the whole content and any specified header and footer. If the property is true the specified PDF page width will be preserved, otherwise the PDF page width is automatically calculated by the converter to display the whole content at real size.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AutoSizePdfPage
member.summary: When the property property is true the converter will automatically calculate the PDF page size such that all the content will be visible in the resulted PDF document. This property has effect only when the and properties are false. When the FitWidth property is false (the content is rendered at real size) and the is false the rendered content could be cut off at the right of the generated PDF document if the PDF page is not wide enough to display the whole content. This property is true by default

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.AvoidTextBreak
member.summary: When true this property instructs the converter to try to avoid cutting off the text between PDF pages. By default this property is true.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.GenerateSelectablePdf
member.summary: When this property is true the generated PDF will contain selectable text. When this property is false, the converter will embed a snapshot image of the document in PDF. The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ShowHeader
member.summary: This property controls the whether the header appears or not in the PDF document generated by the converter. The header properties can be further customized by setting the properties of object exposed by the property of the WordToPdfConverter class. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.ShowFooter
member.summary: This property controls the whether the footer appears or not in the PDF document generated by the converter. The footer properties can be further customized by setting the properties of object exposed by the property of the WordToPdfConverter class. The default value of this property is false.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.EmbedFonts
member.summary: When true this options instructs the converter to embed all the true type fonts in the PDF document generated by the converter. The default value of this property is true

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.TransparentImagesEnabled
member.summary: A flag indicating if the converter uses transparency information of the images in the PDF document generated by the converter. The default property value is true

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfDocumentOptions.TransparencyEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating if the transparency is enabled in the PDF document generated by the converter. Default value is true. This property can be set to false to eliminate the additional flattening time when the document is sent to the printer from Adobe Reader viewer.

member.summary: A reference to the internal object initialized by converter during conversion

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags
member.summary: The submit form action flags to be combined to express various characteristics of the action

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.Default
member.summary: The default value of the flags

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeExclude
member.summary: If clear, the Fields array specifies which fields to include in the submission. If set, the Fields array tells which fields to exclude

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeNoValueFields
member.summary: If set, all fields designated by the Fields array and the Include/Exclude flag shall be submitted, regardless of whether they have a value. For fields without a value, only the field name shall be transmitted. If clear, fields without a value shall not be submitted

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExportFormat
member.summary: Meaningful only if the SubmitPDF and XFDF flags are clear. If set, field names and values shall be submitted in HTML Form format. If clear, they shall be submitted in Forms Data Format

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.GetMethod
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted using an HTTP GET request. If clear, they shall be submitted using a POST request. This flag is meaningful only when the ExportFormat flag is set; if ExportFormat is clear, this flag shall also be clear

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.SubmitCoordinates
member.summary: If set, the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submit-form action shall be transmitted as part of the form data. The coordinate values are relative to the upper-left corner of the field’s widget annotation rectangle. This flag shall be used only when the ExportFormat flag is set. If ExportFormat is clear, this flag shall also be clear

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.XFDF
member.summary: Shall be used only if the SubmitPDF flags are clear. If set, field names and values shall be submitted as XFDF

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeAppendSaves
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF file shall include the contents of all incremental updates to the underlying PDF document, as contained in the Differences entry in the FDF dictionary. If clear, the incremental updates shall not be included

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF file shall include includes all markup annotations in the underlying PDF document. If clear, markup annotations shall not be included

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.SubmitPDF
member.summary: If set, the document shall be submitted as PDF, using the MIME content type application/pdf. If set, all other flags shall be ignored except GetMethod

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.CanonicalFormat
member.summary: If set, any submitted field values representing dates shall be converted to the standard format

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExclNonUserAnnots
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear) and the IncludeAnnotations flag is set. If set, it shall include only those markup annotations whose T entry matches the name of the current user, as determined by the remote server to which the form is being submitted.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExclFKey
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF shall exclude the F entry.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.EmbedForm
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the F entry of the submitted FDF shall be a file specification containing an embedded file stream representing the PDF file from which the FDF is being submitted

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the PDF document security options. The WordToPdfConverter class define a reference to an object of this type in property.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanAssembleDocument
member.summary: Can assemble the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter (create bookmarks, thumbnail images or insert, rotate, delete pages). This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanCopyContent
member.summary: Can copy the content of the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanCopyAccessibilityContent
member.summary: Can copy the PDF document accessibility content of the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanEditAnnotations
member.summary: Can edit the annotations of the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanEditContent
member.summary: Can edit the content of the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanFillFormFields
member.summary: Can fill the form fields in the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter. This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used. To disable form filling the and must be set on false.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanPrint
member.summary: Can print the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter. When this property is set to false the printing of the PDF document is disabled in a PDF viewer.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanPrintHighResolution
member.summary: Can print the PDF document in high resolution the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter. When this property is set to true the PDF document printed in high resolution.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.KeySize
member.summary: The dimension of the encryption key in the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter. By default a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter. The default algorithm is RC4.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.OwnerPassword
member.summary: The password required to change permissions of the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter, like printing or editing. If the property is an empty string and the is not empty, the will be automatically assigned with the value from and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.PdfSecurityOptions.UserPassword
member.summary: The password required to open the PDF document generated by the HTML to PDF converter. If the property is an empty string and the is not empty, the will be automatically assigned with the value from and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.PdfStandardSubset
member.summary: This enumeration represents the possible standards used by a PDF document

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Full
member.summary: The full PDF features can be used in the generated PDF document.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Pdf_A_1b
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/A 1b standard which makes the document suitable for long term archiving. All the true type fonts are embedded in the PDF document, external HTTP links are disabled, transparencies are disabled, and some special metadata to identify the document as PDF/A compliant is inserted in the generated document.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.PdfStandardSubset.Pdf_X_1a
member.summary: The generated PDF is in conformance with PDF/X 1a standard which makes the document suitable for graphics exchange.

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.Security
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the PDF document security options. The class defines a reference to an object of this type in property.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.CanAssembleDocument
member.summary: Can assemble the PDF document (create bookmarks, thumbnail images or insert, rotate, delete pages). This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.CanCopyContent
member.summary: Can copy the PDF document content.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.CanCopyAccessibilityContent
member.summary: Can copy the PDF document accessibility content.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.CanEditAnnotations
member.summary: Can edit PDF document annotations. When this property is set to false the annotations cannot be changed in a PDF editor

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.CanEditContent
member.summary: Can edit PDF document content. When this property is set false the PDF document content cannot be changed in a PDF editor

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.CanFillFormFields
member.summary: Can fill the PDF form fields. This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used. To disable form filling the and must be set on false.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.CanPrintHighResolution
member.summary: Can print the PDF document in high resolution. When this property is set to true the PDF document printed in high resolution.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.CanPrint
member.summary: Can print the PDF document. When this property is set to false the printing of the PDF document is disabled in a PDF viewer.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.KeySize
member.summary: The dimension of the PDF doucument encryption key. The default key size is 128 bits for a newly created PDF document.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: The encryption algorithm used to encrypt the PDF document. The default algorithm is RC4.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.OwnerPassword
member.summary: The password required to change permissions of the PDF document like printing or editing. If the property is an empty string and the is not empty, the will be automatically assigned with the value from and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Security.UserPassword
member.summary: The password required to open the PDF document. If the property is an empty string and the is not empty, the will be automatically assigned with the value from and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Template.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets template height for a custom template. Setting this property for a default document template has no effect.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Template.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the template bounds rectangle. Setting this property for a default template has no effect.

member.summary: Gets or sets the template anchoring inside the PDF page

member.summary: Set this property to indicate whether the template is drawn or not on the odd pages. By default this property is true.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Template.DrawOnEvenPages
member.summary: Set this property to indicate whether the template is drawn or not on the even pages. By default this property is true.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Template.DrawOnFirstPage
member.summary: Set this property to indicate whether the template is drawn or not on the first page. By default this property is true.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Template.PageNumberingStartIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the start index for page numbering using the &p; variable in a TextElement added to the template.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Template.PageNumberingPageCountIncrement
member.summary: Gets or sets an increment for the total number of pages displayed using &P; variable in a TextElement added to the template.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Template.BringToFront
member.summary: When true, this property makes the template to be rendered in front of the page main content. By default this property is true.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.Template.SendToBackground
member.summary: When true, this property makes the template to be rendered in the back of the page main content. By default this property is false.

member.summary: Adds a PDF page element to this template repeated in each PDF page
member.param: The page element to be added

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateAnchoring
member.summary: This enumeration represents the possible anchoring positions of the PDF template in a PDF page

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateAnchoring.NotAnchored
member.summary: The template is not anchored.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateAnchoring.Center
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the center of the PDF page. The center of the template rectangle will be same with the center of the page.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateAnchoring.TopLeft
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the top left corner of the page. The template location will be the top left corner of the page.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateAnchoring.TopRight
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the top right corner of the page. The right side of the template will be aligned with the right side of the page, and the top side of the template will be aligned with the top side of the page

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateAnchoring.BottomLeft
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the bottom left corner of the page. The left side of the template will be aligned with the left side of the page and the bottom side of the document will be aligned with the bottom side of the page.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateAnchoring.BottomRight
member.summary: The template will be anchored in the bottom left corner of the page. The right side of the document will be aligned with the right side of the PDF page and the bottom side of the document will be aligned with the bottom side of the PDF page

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateCollection.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Represents the default PDF document footer template. This footer is automatically considered when calculating the available space for rendering in a PDF page. This template is automatically docked to the bottom of the PDF page.

member.summary: The template is not docked in PDF page.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateDocking.Top

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateDocking.Bottom

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateDocking.Left
member.summary: The template is docked to the left of the PDF page. The template location and height will be adjusted for docking.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateDocking.Right
member.summary: The template is docked to the right of the PDF page. The template location and height will be adjusted for docking.

member.name: F:EvoWordToPdf.TemplateDocking.Fill
member.summary: The template fills the PDF page. The template location will be the top left corner and the size will be the size of the PDF page. The docking will take into account the existing document Header, Footer, Left and Right templates.

member.name: T:EvoWordToPdf.TextElement
member.summary: Represents a text element to be added to a PDF page or template.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.Drawing.Font)
member.summary:
Constructs a paginable text element that will be rendered at the specified (x,y) position using the specified system font. The height of the rendered text will be auto-determined. The width is the available width in page.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A flag indicating if the font is embedded or not in PDF can be specified when the font is added to PDF document.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being limited by the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the auto-determined text height is bigger than the available space on page), all the text will be rendered using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The text to be rendered
The text font as a System.Drawing.Font object.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.Drawing.Font,EvoWordToPdf.PdfColor)
member.summary:
Constructs a paginable text element that will be rendered in the specified rectangle using the specified width, height, system font and color.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A font can be embedded in the generated PDF document if the EmbedSysFont property was set on true.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being given by the minimum between the specified height and the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the specified height is bigger than the available space on page), the height parameter will be ignored and the text will be rendered to the end using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed but the text does not need pagination (the specified height is less than the available space on page), the rendered text will be truncated to fit the specified height. The text bounds inside the current page and the last page index are returned in the object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The width of the destination rectangle. Use a negative value allow text to flow freely in PDF page width.
The height of the destination rectangle. Use a negative value allow text to flow freely in PDF document.
The text to be rendered
The text font as a System.Drawing.Font object.
The text color

If the text pagination is allowed but the text does not need pagination (the specified height is less than the available space on page), the rendered text will be truncated to fit the specified height. The text bounds inside the current page and the last page index are returned in the object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The width of the destination rectangle. Use a negative value allow text to flow freely in PDF page width.
The height of the destination rectangle. Use a negative value allow text to flow freely in PDF document.

The text font standard CJK family.

member.name: M:EvoWordToPdf.TextElement.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.String,EvoWordToPdf.PdfFont)
member.summary:
Constructs a paginable text element that will be rendered at the specified (x,y) position using the specified font. The height of the rendered text will be auto-determined. The width is the available width in page.
The Unicode text is supported only for embedded true type fonts. A flag indicating if the font is embedded or not in PDF can be specified when the font is added to PDF document.
If the text pagination is not allowed ( property is false ), the text will be written on current page, the rendered text height being limited by the available height on page. The remaining text and the text bounds inside the current page are returned in the object when the element is added to a renderer.
If the text pagination is allowed ( property is true ) and the text needs pagination (the auto-determined text height is bigger than the available space on page), all the text will be rendered using the necessary height. The text bounds inside the last page and the last page index are returned in the object when the element is added to a renderer.
member.param: The start x coordinate where the text will be rendered
The start y coordinate where the text
The text to be rendered
The text font. The true type fonts must be embedded in PDF when it is added to the document in order to support Unicode texts.

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance to move the text baseline up or down from its default location. Adjustments to the baseline are useful for drawing superscripts or subscripts. Positive values of text rise move the baseline up and creates a superscript text. Negative values of text rise move the baseline down and creates a subscript text.

member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s menu bar when the document is active when displaying the PDF document generated by the converter. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.ViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the document’s window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document’s contents displayed when displaying the PDF document generated by the converter. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.ViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to resize the document’s window to fit the size of the first displayed page when displaying the PDF document generated by the converter. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.ViewerPreferences.CenterWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to position the document’s window in the center of the screen when displaying the PDF document generated by the converter. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.ViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the window’s title bar should display the document title taken from the title entry of the document information dictionary when displaying the PDF document generated by the converter. Default value: False.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.ViewerPreferences.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: The document’s page mode, specifying how to display the document on exiting full-screen mode when displaying the PDF document generated by the converter. This entry is meaningful only if the value of the PageMode entry in the catalog dictionary is FullScreen; it is ignored otherwise. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.ViewerPreferences.Direction
member.summary: The predominant reading order for text when displaying the PDF document generated by the converter. Default value: L2R.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.ViewerPreferences.PageMode
member.summary: Specifies how the PDF document generated by the converter should be displayed when opened. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: P:EvoWordToPdf.ViewerPreferences.PageLayout
